text:
If you have delivery or pick up here be ready that you will be blocked by the train 🚂

I was stocked for 30 min !
Nice personal working here!

name: Bryon Foxx
text: Easy in and out. Great group of guys

name: James Nabors
text: Very good. And dependable co ,will allways do busnnes with them

name: john hulstrunk
text: Excellent quick service

name: Jason Brown
text: Great place for well and pump parts

name: Samantha Murphy
text: i love my family company

name: BigAmericanShark
text: For all your Water Well needs!

name: MICHAEL CARPENTER
text:
Super Pleased! We went through a Home Warranty Co ( that is a whole different story...run away) and Ms. Sylvia scheduled her drillers to come out first call before their normal day to check to see if they could do damage control and get us some water.

Background: We have a well and had a Lightning Strike - no water!

They were able to get us water until the Electrician Co. could come out and fix/replace what they had to do. Super Pleased.

A little more Background: I am extremely familiar with Well Drilling & Pump Companies. Since my Sister & Brother in Law owns a Large Well Drilling Co in Maryland and he (they) were Past President of a Water Well Drilling Association. So I understand what the Gold Standard is; This company meets and exceeds such standard.

So many thanks! As you see, I put my name behind this review of this company. Many know who I am and if not me, surely my wife, Dr. Teresa Carpenter DVM

name: Sonya Ketcham
text: Awesome staff and work! I highly recommend this company!

name: Doyle H.
text:
RECOMMEND WRIGHTS PUMP AND WELL DRILLING!Replaced pump, suggested to claim it on homeowners insurance.  Had to come back a month later and replace the pump wiring that he charged me for initially a month earlier.

Two years later,  pump quits, Wrights pump and well drilling changed the pump out. Figured out that Hughes used a used pump even though he charged me for a new one.  Highly recommend Wrights well drilling.
Stay away from Hughes!!

name: William Caughlan
text: We have used this company twice for our residential well and they came as soon as I called. Very professional and helpful getting our well back up. But that was 3-4 years ago. I called them for repairs 3 weeks ago and haven’t heard from them yet. I call three times and the receptionist said I guess Wendall didn’t get the message.

name: Jenny Henderson
text: They came out and fixed our well the same day I called them. They done a great job.

name: brian douglas
text: Quick, courteous service. Highly recommended.

name: James Baxley
text:
Waited 3 months. Never bothered to call me. I got someone else. Mr. Hughes came out and looked at my place . Wide open pasture.
Another well driller told me that if you're not in need of an industrial well, or chicken house well, you're not gonna get any attention from them. Definitely don't call them for a residential well. BTW, his quote was 1000 bucks more.

name: Robert Parker
text: Prompt and professional.  My pump died and Mr. Hughes with crew arrived the same day for repairs.  Replaced the pump and a couple other bad components.  Cleaned up after their work. Price is reasonable.  Especially when compared to other parts of the country. I’ve been doing business with this company for over twenty years and never disappointed.

name: Jessie Johnson
text: Fast friendly reliable service locally owned and operated.dependable highly recommend this business.

name: Rocky Miller
text: It's the Greatest!!!!

name: clayton west
text: Professional and knowledgeable service from a man that's been  drilling wells for over 40 years.   We couldn't be happier with the results.

name: Alaina Samuels
text: Pat Hurst was excellent.  He returned my phone call the same day and answered all of my questions.  He was able to work us into his schedule in a very reasonable time and was very professional throughout the whole process.  Pat is very experienced in his field, and he was extremely patient and made sure we had everything we needed.  We had a wonderful experience with Hurst Well Drilling and would highly recommend them to anyone.

name: Mary Knoechel
text:
We hired Pat Hurst to dig a well for us back in 2013.
We blindly trusted him to do the right thing.
He did not wire our pump properly causing our pump to fry-up. We were without water for an entire year.
Be aware! Look elsewhere.

name: Carl Katterson
text: Always been fair and good for me

name: Jeremy Alexander
text: Absolutely Top Notch!! Flexible, accommodating, friendly and efficient.

name: Raymond Trehern
text: Fast service

name: Malinda Bell
text: Mr. Jackson is an awesome man. He is the best in Winston County.  The only place we could get what we needed and the help we needed on a weekend. Would give him 10*'s if I could. Thank you sir for what you do! (And the roll pipe with the right amt of psi)

name: Holly White
text: Was very helpful

name: Christopher Spencer
text: The owner was very rude on the phone and said he didn't want to be bothered.

name: Mike M.
text: Randy and his team did a great job clearing two large lots for us under some challenging wet weather conditions. Highly recommend!

name: Malinda Bell
text: Good place. Some are nice others didn't care if you were their or not they just wanted a their pay. I have never treated anyone nasty in the restaurant business because I worked in Fast Food 10yrs. Its pays to be nice.

name: Lisa Jefferson
text: Randy has digital cameras that enables him to see within our well, and save us thousands of dollars during the closing of our house. During a last minute emergency, he drilled a new well for us and has always given us outstanding service. Highly recommend.

name: Mark Bush
text: Randy cleared some property for me using his skid steer mulcher.  He did a good job and didn't leave downed trees sitting on or around the edges of the property.

name: me to you
text:
Update:  7 Dec 2020.  After a year of begging Alms Pump to come reconnect the electric wires in the older pump house that they disconnected to put a check valve,  I had to hire an electrician ($126) to come restore electricity in the pump house so that the lights could be turned on for freezing weather that was 2 days after the 2 days of freezing weather.  The bulb receptacle that was removed without my permission was bought and remounted as the backup bulb.
It makes no sense to mistreat a customer who is a disabled Army Veteran and have been a loyal paying customer.

Buyer beware

Alms pump does not care about their customers.  You cannot trust them to do the job right especially if you leave them and trust that they will do right by you.   I paid $450 for a check valve but the aggravation they caused me for a year to reconnect the electric wires they disabled, removed a light bulb socket without my permission, and had leaking pipes at the new pump, I should charge them $500 or more.

So, buyer beware.
*********************************
Nov 10, 2020 update:
Alm Pump finally came to fix the leaking pipes..  Hurricane Sally busted the leaking pipes open and water was pumped on the grounds for 2 to 3 days and nights. It could have burned up the new pump. I wondered why there were 4 inches of water on the ground 3 days after the hurricane. Wading through the water, I discovered the pump gushing water from the pipe at the pump.  I shut off the power to the pump. Then called Alms Pump.
Their reply was that they had people without water and it would be a couple of days. Well, about 6 weeks later Alms Pump showed up and fixed the pipes to the pump and turned the water back on.  The bill for that meter where no water was used was $60.  This was the first bill where payment was only for water used plus taxes.
As to the older pump, Alms Pump  never went to the  pump house of the older pump and never reconnect the electric wires they disconnected to bring the pump and pipes out of the ground to put a new check valve on the pipe of the older pump.
I have begged Alms Pump to reconnect the wires in the pump house so that the electric plugs can be used to run extension cord to where 2 junipers fell in the yard and need cutting.  To this day, Nov 10, 2020, the 2 juniper are still down.
There is no electricity to the switch for the light bulb when freezing weather comes.

My attorney wrote Alms Pump  a letter and it was ignored.  I gave Alms Pump until 31 Oct 2020 to reconnect the electric wires and that was ignored.

They will not answer as to why they will not reconnect the electric wires they disconnected.  I paid Alms Pump $450 for repairing the older pump (putting in a new check valve).
If I have to hire an electrician to reconnect the wires Alms Pump disconnected, would that make Alms Pumps liable for the payment? My attorney says yes, and, they should be taken to Small Claims Court.

The senior Alms who started Alms Pump never mistreated their customers as I have been grossly mistreated by this younger generation running Allms Pump.

I will never call Alms Pump to put down another well and pump. Fini.

Previous post in Sep 2020:
Not responding to fix the leaking T under the valve they installed.  I have done business with Alms Pump for over 30 years and do not understand why they are not responding to come fix their work. A plumber would not touch it.

Alms Pump. Please come fix your work.
